comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Capt.W. F. Abbott, an Arts graduate of Wesley in 1912, has been awarded the military cross for his work at Passchendaele Ridge in the latter part of October. He went overseas with the Winnipeg Grenadiers and is at present attached to the 9th Canadian Field Ambulance. Vox Wesleyana 1918 February cdm15931.contentdm.oclc.org/cdm/singleitem/collection/p15... Also www.cmp-cpm.forces.gc.ca/dhh-dhp/his/docs/CFGW_MedSvc_e.pdf Notes on the action at Passchendaele involving Abbott here archive.org/stream/historicalrecord00gunnuoft/historicalr... William Frederick Abbott born 1890 R.M. of South Cypress, Manitoba. 1921 Canadian Census: William Frederick Abbott age 31, mother Annie Abbott, father Albert Edward Abbott, brother Albert Clifford Abbott - age 23 Married Olive Mary Roberts 10 Jun 1925 - Winnipeg, Manitoba. Dr William F Abbott Voters' List Manitoba 1963. www.ancestry.ca

O. Grave 556. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=59358016 Here's another WIlliam Frederick Abbott Birth: 1899 Death: Jun. 4, 1990 Adelaide South Australia, Australia of Findon Note: Aged 91 years Burial: Enfield Memorial Park Adelaide South Australia, Australia Plot: Eastern Niche Wall No 1 - NA-NW 6-1

comment.author: 75401644@N02
comment._content: Ron in Canada newspaperarchive.com/winnipeg-free-press/1975-01-04/page-37 Dr. W. F. Abbott On January 2, 1974 at the Grace Hospital, Doctor William Frederick Abbott aged 84 years, beloved husband of Olive Mary Abbott ............ Dr. Abbott served in the Medical Corps with the Winnipeg Grenadiers, Seaforth Highlanders and the 9th Field Ambulance during the First World War and received the Military Cross in 1917. He was associated with the Army Reserve Force and retired as Lt. Colonel. obituary has more including picture also canadiangreatwarproject.com/searches/soldierDetail.asp?ID...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Winnipeg Free Press obit cont:
Surviving besides his wife are his brother Dr A C Abbott, son Dr W E Abbott both of Winnipeg, and a daughter, Mrs O Scott of Selkirk, Man. and five grandchildren.
